gw.plugin.assignment

    public final class AssignmentCommand
extends GWEnumeration
    The assignment commands available for the assignment resolver

    • Field Detail

      • ASSIGN_VERBATIM

        public static final AssignmentCommand ASSIGN_VERBATIM
        Assign to the specified group and user without further interpretation.

      • ASSIGN_ISSUE_OWNER

        public static final AssignmentCommand ASSIGN_ISSUE_OWNER
        Assign to the parent item's owner without further interpretation. For example, if this is returned as the result of a request to assign an exposure, then the exposure will be assigned to the same user as its owning claim. This same logic applies to activities.

        Returns of this value against a claim assignment request are handled slightly differently. If the claim already has an owner, then no change in ownership is made and a warning is logged. If the claim has no owner (that is, it is newly created) then the claim is assigned to the default owner and an error is logged.

        Generally, this value should not be returned for claim assignment requests.

      • ASSIGN_ROUND_ROBIN_USER

        public static final AssignmentCommand ASSIGN_ROUND_ROBIN_USER
        Assign to the next user in the specified group.

      • ASSIGN_ROUND_ROBIN_WITHIN_GROUPS

        public static final AssignmentCommand ASSIGN_ROUND_ROBIN_WITHIN_GROUPS
        Assign to the next user in the pseudo-group defined as the set of all (distinct) users within all groups of a type specified by the groupTypeID. Load factors are obeyed, but are distinct from load factors used in ASSIGN_ROUND_ROBIN_USER responses.

      • ASSIGN_PRIOR_INVOLVEMENT

        public static final AssignmentCommand ASSIGN_PRIOR_INVOLVEMENT
        Assign to a user in a specified group who worked on the item.

        "Prior involvement" is defined as anyone who:

        • is the current case owner
        • is currently the owner of a subcase belonging to the case
        • is currently the owner of an activity associated with the case, whether the activity is still open or already closed
        • is the previous owner of the case
        • is the previous owner of a subcase
        • is the previous owner of an activity associated with the case
        The conditions are checked in that order, so preference is given to an exposure owner over an activity owner, for example.

        The term PRIOR is defined as relative to the time the call is made.

        Assume a claim is persistent and assigned to user 23. Now assume some code is executed that reads the claim from persistent store and modifies the assigned user to be 87, and then makes a call to an assignment engine that returns ASSIGN_PRIOR_INVOLVEMENT. What would happen is that the Claim would be assigned to user 87.

        This implies, then, that the called must be at least reasonably aware of the context of its calling. The context may (likely will) be inferred.

      • ASSIGN_USE_DEFAULT

        public static final AssignmentCommand ASSIGN_USE_DEFAULT
        Assign based on default ClaimCenter algorithms.

      • ASSIGN_MANUALLY

        public static final AssignmentCommand ASSIGN_MANUALLY
        Assign manually.

      • ASSIGN_NOT_FOUND

        public static final AssignmentCommand ASSIGN_NOT_FOUND
        Indicates that the rules engine was unable to arrive at a decision about how to assign the entity. The result of this return is determined by the execution path. In one case, the error will be propagated to the user for resolution, and in another assignment to the default owner will be performed.
